item.title: Liberation and Community at Imperial is an Issue for Today
item.author: Shervin Sabeghi,
item.description: Above: Only men were allowed to drink in the Union Bar fifty years ago The rights and freedoms for minority groups around the world are never handed on a platter – they are hard fought through liberation movements. From international women’s suffrage in the late 19th century, the American Civil …

item.title: After a six year break from the music scene, Dido is still on my mind
item.author: Shervin Sabeghi,
item.description: A warm cup of tea on a cold day – this is how I’d best sum up Dido. Though unassuming both in the recording studio and out, she’s managed to feature twice on the list of the top ten best-selling albums of the noughties and wrack up four BRIT Awards. Her first two albums No Angel and Life for Rent …

item.title: Wait – you can be happy and healthy at Imperial?!
item.author: Shervin Sabeghi,
item.description: Woohoo it’s self-care awareness week! I hope you’re as excited about that as I am! No? Okay – well keep reading and see how you feel at the end. When I first became RCSU Welfare Officer (aka ‘The RCSU Condom Guy’), I wanted to put self-care on my agenda from the off. It’s something I don’t feel is …
